text:
bu au restaurant IIDA-YA à Dole
Pas de couleur pointe effervescence
Nez sur la fleur
Attaque sur lanis et pointe effervescente

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Bottle - Some anise and melon with a touch of pear. Clear like water. Sweet pear and a nice light rice/marzipan finish with a touch of anise again. Booze is in check and quite complex.
Bottle at Legacy Liquor, VancouverPale shade strong aroma, flowers, mekon, honeydew, alcohol.Off dry, smooth, good body, prunes, light watermelon and litchi; warming alcohol.Very nice.
Bottle. Served warm! A clear pale yellow colour. An aroma of alcohol and fruit. A dry Sake with sweet notes from the alcohol.
First Sake ever. Smakar ris, vattnig och svag vodka. Nyans av uteliggare. MÅNS NILEMARK DAMN YOU
Sample @ SBWF 12. Clear colour. Sweet rice, alcohol aroma. Sweet alcohol flavour.

Aroma is rice, mild alcohol, some slight fruity and spicy notes. Flavour is wood, resin, mild sweet rice and some slight alcoholic sweetness pushing through as well.

Bottle. My first sake rating! Clear, very light yellow/green grape liquid. Almost looks like water. Some nice lacing. Aroma of pear, alcohol/acetone, rice and white bread. The booze brings down the score, but the pear-like notes are really nice. Taste is dry (maybe very little sweet) with notes of almonds, white bread, bit rice and not much more. A bit watery. medium bodied. Finishes to the sweeter side with some alcohol burn. Overall, watery and bit boozy but still has nice aspects to it. Dont mind drinking it.
nice rice aroma,pale, clear, light sweetness, light body,creamy, soft carbonation, nice soft rice finish.
White and clear as water. Has no head. Aroma of fermented rice, not nice. Flavor is sweet. Texture syrupy. No carbonation.
Bottle. Clear water colour. Moderate marcipan aroma. Average moderate marcipoan flavor. Average finish. Oily palate. Boring sake.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Halden, Norway. My first Sake rating. Together with some Sushi.
Clear light yellow/green colour and no head. A light tequila aroma. Some rice probably. Moderate sweet flavour and a bit waterish. Some rice i guess, and not much alcohol taste. Maybee some light citrus in the back of my mouth.
I love Sushi, have to get used to sake.....
It was not bad, so I probably try another one next time I eat Sushi.
Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012. Pours clear no col. Sweet vomit, rice and coconut.
clear as water. An aroma of pear, wood, spice, tequila and sweets. A flavor of sweets, pear, spice and alcohol.
Bottle. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice, almond and and a little liquorice. Flavour is rice, almond, sweet, little liquorice with notes of alcohol.
Clear as water. Aroma is sweet, rice and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. 280112
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is water. Aroma and taste are rice malt, alcohol and marzipan notes.

300 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Small sample (~60ml) comsumed on November 18. Served warm. Pours clear with a slight greenish yellow tone to it. Smell is sweet white rice, alcohol, allspice and candy banana. Taste is sweet with rice, sweet pears and a warming alcohol sensation. Finish is dry, slightly sweet and rather watery. Quite allright...

Bottle 720ml. @ [ The Pool Tabel Tasting in Rome ].Crystal clear water colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, light alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration, neutral and simple. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20101220]

300 ml bottle kindly shared by Sigmund. Crystal clear, colorless with no head. Aroma has vinous notes, and fusel alcohol in it. Flavors are alcoholic and light acidic. Full body. Oily and completely flat. Dry finish verging on astringent.

Not used to taste sake this cold, but I was recommended to try this served chilled. So I did. It pours bright crystal clear - as sake often does. Aroma is as normal quite low when served chilled, but if I take some time and look deep I can perhaps find some sweet flowery notes along with some woody hints and the obvious yeast and rice. Warming stingy alcohol down the throat and ends in a dry finish and watery aftertaste. Could it be some dry almonds I taste as well there? Yeah, I think so. Nice and sweet alcohol aftertaste.

Second attempt, again sampled thanx to Sigmund. Pours clear as water, slightly oily in glass, strong alcohol aroma, sweet spicy. Taste is milder than suggested by the aroma, not my thing. For heavens sake, give me a beer.

Bottle 300ml
Pours clear as water with no head. Aroma has notes of rice and almonds. Taste is light sweet. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.
aroma of rubbing alcohol, and some light rice. flavor is quite meaty, and more booze. This is really awful.
Bottle. Clear colour with no head. Aroma is rice , alcohol. Flavour is rice alcohol, yeast, floral. Mild sake.

Bottle. Pours a pale yellow body. Nose is alcohol, rice and hints of perfumed jasmine. Taste is bland, with a soapy, oily palate that doesnt do me no good for sure. Faint almond tones, and some grainy hints but mostly a doughy kind of alcohol taste with hints of soap. Some vague fruity notes hidden in the mid-palate, but all in all this is not a very good drink in my honest opinion, although it is somehow smoother than other sakes Ive tasted which kinda brings it up a little bit.

Bottle. A still, clear, colorless sake. Seems to be a hint of color actually. Oily pour. Some alcohol in the aroma, with apples and pears and some rice. Hints of citrus fruits and a faint cardboard note. Oily and medium bodied, a bit more warming than pleasant. Some sweetness in the flavor, mostly dry though, with a good fruityness. Alcohol and fruityness in the finish. A pleasant one, tasteful, but too evident on the alcohol. 100716
Bottle.Pours clear and still.Aroma of alcohol ,butter,rice and yeast with some floral notes.Flavour is rice ,yeast ,water and alcohol .

300 ml green bottle, from Vinmonopolet. ABV is 15%. Clear, nearly colourless, like water. No carbonation. Aroma of dust, boiled rice, cardboard, fusel alcohol and stale marzipan. Flavour of rice soaked in raw alcohol. The great point about sake still eludes me.

Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Clear golden with a yellowish tint. Sweetish, fat rice aroma. Medium body with a somewhat flat mouthfeel. Sweetish rice, a little caramel and a very alcoholic finish. 190209
Botella. Totally clear. Rice mild fruity  aroma. Good mouthfeel. Bitter rice fruity flavour with some alcohol noticed. Soft bit dry rice bitter finish.

30cl bottle
aroma is boozy, in-your-head-booze.
flavor is fruity, mild, boozy
the booze is sort of too much in the fron of the flavor.
30 cL bottle. Pours clear and colourless, no head. Mild rice aroma. Dry wooden and light fruity flavoured. Clean and crisp. Ends with a mild alcohol warmth. Smooth and well hidden alcohol.
Served hot at Fuji-Ya.   A little sweet, clear, obviously filtered. Fairly light, a starter sake.  It was cheap anyway.

130ml glass served lukewarm with a great sushi meal at Alex Sushi in Oslo. Blank in appearance with a sweet spicy smell and flavour added by some kind of fruit and a bite of anise. Masked alcohol. Went well alongside with the raw fish, but otherwise not impressive. My first sake and maybe again - on a sushi place [Oslo, 18.11.2008].

30cl bottle from Systembolaget (just to keep the streak going). First sake I try besides some disgusting Gekkeikan.

Clean and clear looking, with a clean, sweetish aroma of... feint caramel? Clean taste, again a bit sweetish but reminding me of a very mild and clean gin albeit without any juniper.

I think, anyway...

30 cl bottle bought at Systembolaget. Pours transpearnt with a yellowish glow. Powerful fruity aroma with licorice and alcohol. Tastes rather complex with subdued licorice competing with bread. Medium sweetness. Full-bodied. Nice.

Bottle (30 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear, still, and almost without color. Alcoholic, a bit perfumy, with clear notes of rice and perhaps I can sense some tropical fruits as well. Medium bodied and a bit oily mouthfeel. A light acidity in the flavour. This is not my cup of tea.

Clear, halfway between uncoloured and milky, still. Rather disturbing aroma of oxidized rice hulls and stuffy, unpolished grains. Buttery, nutty and quite fragrant, but all along carrying this oxidized note. Rather full bodied, almost sticky à la Basmati. Rather poor example I found, but my experience is very limited indeed.

Overflowing cup in a Watame in Tamachi. Clear, thick legs, nose of fresh koji and a  creamy rice note. The flavor has a light buttery character with a not so overpowering alcohol note to round out the acidity. Nice clean flavor, not as much in the bouquet department. Decent, woody and full with character. Bubble gum tasting finish. Kampai!

Picked up a 1800 ml bottle from Haskels in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Served chilled. Pours a clear, crystal water color. Aroma of faint pear, a touch of lychee and alcohol. Taste is slightly dry, light fragrance, with an alcohol burn. More alcohol finish than a sweet streamed rice flavor.

Tasted along with the Gold Futsu and the Karakuchi Junmai. This one presents a bready character to the nose, more than the regular (or basic) Gold. Taste is sharper and more straight forward, while the body is cleaner than the regular Gold.
[Sampled at salon des vins, Montréal 2006, slightly cold ~10C]

Like the gold, this has still lots of bready character in aroma, like wet dough rising. Cleaner taste in mouth, less sweet, more sharpness. Supposedly, they clean the rice more from its hull and outer layer, resulting in this cleaner, more subtil taste. At Salon des Vins et Spiritueux de Montréal, March 25 2006.
A clear sake with a sweet aroma of flowers. The flavor is sweet with light notes of alcohol, and rice. I found it rather simple
Sweet rice nose, w/fruit and faint apple. Light w/ mid sweeetness and a lingering finish. Alcohol present on finish, with a tangy element that is nice, though not that well balanced.
